Generation III.Ruby: Dustox is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this Pok é mon are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.
Generation III.Sapphire: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pok é mon searches for food using its antennae like radar.
Generation III.Emerald: It is a nocturnal Pok é mon that flies from fields and mountains to the attraction of streetlights at night. It looses highly toxic powder from its wings.
Generation III.FireRed: It scatters horribly toxic dust when it senses danger. They tend to gather in the glow of streetlamps at night.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It scatters horribly toxic dust when it senses danger. They tend to gather in the glow of streetlamps at night.

Generation IV.Diamond: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.
Generation IV.Pearl: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
Generation IV.Platinum: Toxic powder is scattered with each flap. At night, it is known to strip leaves off trees lining boulevards.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It scatters its fine dust all over when it is attacked. It is a nocturnal Pokémon.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It scatters its fine dust all over when it is attacked. It is a nocturnal Pokémon.

Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.
